snippet: Afghan and foreign officials say that corruption can no longer be described as a cancer on the system: It is the system.
abstract: Wide array of Afghan and foreign officials say rampant bribery and extortion is so deeply enmeshed with Afghan politics that corruption is not a blight on the system but has become the system itself; American officials estimate corruption costs country half its customs revenue, which was over $1 billion in 2012.
lead_paragraph: Afghan and foreign officials say that corruption can no longer be described as a cancer on the system: It is the system.
